Package View

Interface IView

All Known Implementing Classes:
View
public interface IView
Interface IView contains methods required in Danemon View classes

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    closeStartPanel()
    Method closeStartPanel() will remove the starting JPanel from the frame
    void
    createAttackMenu(ArrayList<String> titles)
    Method createAttackMenu() sets the actionPanel() to include 4 buttons for the user battling Pokemon's attack options
    void
    createImagePanel(String userPokemonURL, String userPokemonName, String userPokemonHealth, String userPokemonCurrentHealth, String userParty, String enemyPokemonURL, String enemyPokemonName, String enemyPokemonHealth, String enemyPokemonCurrentHealth, String enemyParty)
    Method createImagePanel() sets the imagePanel with the Battling Pokemon, their names and their current health out of overall health.
    void
    createTextPanel(String text)
    Method createTextPanel() updates the actionPanel to display only the text passed in
    JButton
    getButton(String name)
    Method getButton() returns the JButton object with the same associated name
    void

    Method refreshFrame() will update the frame with the latest content that has been added
    void
    setListeners(ActionListener clicks)
    Sets actionListeners on each button of the View

  • Method Details

    • getButton

      JButton getButton(String name) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Method getButton() returns the JButton object with the same associated name
      Parameters:
      name - string name of the JButton property in the IView class
      Returns:
      JButton with matching string name
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the provided button name does not exist in the IView

    • setListeners

      void setListeners(ActionListener clicks)
      Sets actionListeners on each button of the View
      Parameters:
      clicks - ActionListener: method for button clicks

    • closeStartPanel

      void closeStartPanel()
      Method closeStartPanel() will remove the starting JPanel from the frame

    • refreshFrame

      void refreshFrame()
      Method refreshFrame() will update the frame with the latest content that has been added

    • createImagePanel

      void createImagePanel(String userPokemonURL, String userPokemonName, String userPokemonHealth, String userPokemonCurrentHealth, String userParty, String enemyPokemonURL, String enemyPokemonName, String enemyPokemonHealth, String enemyPokemonCurrentHealth, String enemyParty)
      Method createImagePanel() sets the imagePanel with the Battling Pokemon, their names and their current health out of overall health.
      Parameters:
      userPokemonURL - String: absolute url to image of the user's battling Pokemon
      userPokemonName - String: name of the user's battling Pokemon
      userPokemonHealth - String: overall health of the user's battling Pokemon
      userPokemonCurrentHealth - String: current health of the user's battling Pokemon
      enemyPokemonURL - String: absolute url to image of the enemy's battling Pokemon
      enemyPokemonName - String: name of the enemy's battling Pokemon
      enemyPokemonHealth - String: overall health of the enemy's battling Pokemon
      enemyPokemonCurrentHealth - String: current health of the enemy's battling Pokemon

    • createTextPanel

      void createTextPanel(String text) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Method createTextPanel() updates the actionPanel to display only the text passed in
      Parameters:
      text - String: text to display in actionPanel
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when text is null or empty

    • createAttackMenu

      void createAttackMenu(ArrayList<String> titles) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Method createAttackMenu() sets the actionPanel() to include 4 buttons for the user battling Pokemon's attack options
      Parameters:
      titles - ArrayList: list of attack names for the user's Pokemon. Expects 4 names
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when 4 attack names aren't provided
